Text:
This settlement is a huge win for the #USWNT and pay equality in the United States. These athletes have done a tremendous job in advocating for gender equality in soccer, which will undoubtedly have an impact on other sports as well.
https://t.co/ueEvLw2V5H

Trump capitulated to Putin on the world stage in Helsinki and was then impeached for withholding military aid to Ukraine. For whatever reason, he has always acted in the interest of Russia so it's no surprise that he is now praising Putin for invading Ukraine. https://t.co/Dv3wiWVMJl

For too many Americans, rent is far too high and home ownership is simply out of reach.
 
It is past time for the federal government to make serious investments to expand affordable housing and provide additional rental assistance to those who need it.

#BigTech continues to prioritize profits over people while fighting to preserve its lack of accountability. Next week I’m holding a hearing as part of our ongoing work to build a safer internet and hold Big Tech accountable.
https://t.co/eLwZvxElud

Far too many students are unable to afford higher education and are forced to take on significant student debt. With the new Scarlet Guarantee program, @RutgersU will make the dream of higher education a reality for so many students who otherwise wouldn't be able to attend. https://t.co/HsPkkfLipI

Today, @POTUS announced new sanctions on Russian banking institutions, its sovereign debt, and members of Putin's inner circle. He also made clear that tougher sanctions are coming should this invasion continue and firmly repledged unity and strong support for our NATO allies. https://t.co/0I6zHJzohR

On March 1, my office will begin accepting applications for nominations to the U.S. Service Academies. If you're interested in serving our country & applying for a Congressional nomination, you can request an application packet by completing the form below.https://t.co/JrNM9JmvsZ

It's not surprising that Erdogan has once again ignored his NATO commitments – this time by opposing harsh sanctions against Russia at such a critical moment.

The U.S. and our allies should not allow him to get away with consistently choosing self-interest over allied unity. https://t.co/j3NpbCsVk6

I strongly support @POTUS and Germany's move to shut down Nord Stream 2 in the wake of Russia's further escalation of the conflict in Ukraine. Putin has shown he won't listen to diplomacy alone, and it's time to inflict harsher economic punishments to halt his deadly actions. https://t.co/T3ouXNtuXT

The Federal Court in Louisiana is wrong for not allowing the Biden Administration to consider the climate impacts of oil and gas drilling. New drilling will undoubtedly have an impact on the climate crisis.
https://t.co/Zxg3Y7Eazs

While it is encouraging that Putin has agreed to a meeting in principle with President Biden, we must continue to put pressure on Russia. We can still try to prevent an invasion through diplomacy and avert this crisis that Putin has created.
https://t.co/nLqE6CUrFe
On #PresidentsDay, we honor and celebrate our nation's Presidents for their role in protecting and preserving our democracy. https://t.co/ER9sPMXglw

Family caregivers should not be forced into bankruptcy caring for their aging parents. That’s why I provided funding for home and community based care in the Build Back Better Act and will continue to push for initiatives that provide long-term care coverage for seniors. https://t.co/DdUgLXWEsM

Throughout his term as President, Trump abused the power of his position to enrich himself and his family members. Now, he's cashing in to partner with the Saudi rulers who have committed countless human rights abuses. 
https://t.co/nkfMkTg9sY

Last month, @GovMurphy signed legislation to limit police presence at polling places and ballot drop boxes. It’s good to see New Jersey is protecting ballot access, as opposed to red states that are passing voter suppression laws.
https://t.co/lzB70hWGS3

Unlike Russia and China, the United States and NATO are committed to promoting freedom and democracy throughout the world. We must continue to work with our allies to counteract authoritarian leaders like Putin and Xi.
https://t.co/r7I7G2feBH

I agree with @SenatorMenendez. Throughout the pandemic, corporate profits have soared while millions of Americans are forced to pay more for the goods they need. Too many companies are using inflation as an excuse to price gouge.
https://t.co/tg4QNFPQC3

Solidarity among western democratic nations may have deterred the threat of Russian invasion so far, but the U.S. and our allies will continue to stand with Ukraine.
 
Putin is frantically searching for a pretext to a war that the rest of the world is trying to prevent. https://t.co/eSFfsKk0U6

Americans are sick and tired of #robocalls. They’re a nuisance and they undermine public confidence in our communications systems, which is why my TRACED Act took direct aim at combating them. 

Kudos to @FCC for using every tool at its disposal to crack down on them. https://t.co/F7CG90WCqL

A third of Americans live in apartments or other multi-tenant buildings, where residents often only have one option for internet service. Glad to see @FCC prohibiting “sweetheart agreements” between landlords & internet providers to stifle competition in exchange for kickbacks.

I have long criticized social media’s role in the spread of dangerous misinformation. Time and again platforms have promised, but failed, to do better. This is more evidence that self-regulation is not working and that legislation is needed to hold these platforms accountable. https://t.co/NFvgxH8mXI

Thanks to the Biden Admin for taking #EnvironmentalJustice seriously. @WHCEQ’s groundbreaking new tool will ensure our climate and environment investments actually reach those who need them most & that historically underserved communities will no longer be left out. #Justice40 https://t.co/SqXrWqpu57

Safe drinking water is basic human right. That’s why I fought to include $15 billion in the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw to replace lead service lines. 

I’ll continue to fight for funding for our state so that everyone can trust the water coming out of the tap. https://t.co/ZRDhVplqqd

Get ready, NJ! Next week is the start of Boost NJ2 Week. Now is the time to get your booster shot if you haven’t already. 

These shots protect against severe illness and hospitalization, so visit https://t.co/7XSSXdHKp6 to find a vaccination location close to you. https://t.co/GKlO1HKJUT

I’m pleased to hear this is moving forward. Outerbridge Crossing is an important regional link for commuters and tourists alike. I support the expansion or potential replacement of this bridge that is so vital to our state’s economy. https://t.co/m1GBpmtHWr

I applaud @FERC for taking action today to ensure climate change and #EnvironmentalJustice are core considerations of its natural gas pipeline certification process. This is a significant step towards tackling one of the defining challenges of our time. https://t.co/RuzoxAWoyH

It’s good to see @usedgov continue to take action against universities and colleges that lure prospective students under false pretenses. 

Students deserve to attend schools that are solely dedicated to education and preparation for the future.    
https://t.co/11dj10gj0Y

This is more evidence that getting vaccinated during pregnancy can help protect infants after they are born. Infants with mothers who had gotten either the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine were far less likely to be hospitalized if they contracted #COVID19. 
https://t.co/WbcexFmUWW

Today I'm holding a #SubOversight hearing on addressing barriers to mental health care as we work to ensure that all Americans can access the care and support they need, especially during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/BZxgOldjuU
Join me NOW for my weekly update! https://t.co/ubN9phbrWe

Coastal states like New Jersey are on the front lines of the climate crisis. It’s clear the transition to a clean economy is more important than ever so we can lower carbon pollution, create new good-paying jobs, and prevent the worst of sea level rise. 
https://t.co/uNyJJF71No

Today I held a hearing to make sure the historic $65 billion broadband investment we made in the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw helps communities across the country get connected online. #DemocratsDeliver https://t.co/vpNnPXBAGi

Broadband internet is not a luxury - it is a necessity.  It’s needed for Americans to do their jobs, run their small businesses, study for school, meet with their doctor for a telehealth visit, and connect with family and friends. https://t.co/RGb5anr1Bo

While this cannot erase the suffering of the families who lost loved ones on that horrific day, it begins to hold gun manufacturers accountable for building and marketing assault weapons. We should not allow these companies to endanger our schools, workplaces, and communities. https://t.co/q8yxLLIkeH

Thanks to the #AmericanRescuePlan, New Jersey families struggling with utility bills may be eligible for assistance. 

The Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program can help families who qualify keep up with their energy bills and make sure they can keep their heat on. https://t.co/BQB4kwYgc0

This is just more proof that the climate crisis is real, and that it’s happening now. 

This is why I’ve been leading the charge to transition to a clean economy, so we can lower carbon pollution and prevent the worst effects of this crisis.
https://t.co/1KrQitkkhp

@MayorBollwage The #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw invested $1.5 billion for the #BrownfieldsProgram, and it’s crucial that Congress continue to support it. By removing pollution and restoring abandoned properties, brownfield cleanups increase property values and allow new businesses to open.

I held a hearing today on the #BrownfieldsProgram that revitalizes contaminated properties to protect public health and restore local economies. My home state of New Jersey has over 500 brownfield sites. I want to thank @MayorBollwage of Elizabeth for his testimony. https://t.co/qrUO6bJnyd

.@DanReiman and I announced today that Carteret will receive $6 million from @USDOT to build a passenger ferry terminal. This funding will help improve efficient and reliable transportation options for residents who commute to downtown Manhattan. https://t.co/N8JGjlxkdt

This is great for New Jersey, but we need federal action to lower prescription drug costs. 

That’s why I’ve been leading efforts in Congress to finally give Medicare the ability to negotiate lower drug prices – including insulin - with pharmaceutical companies. https://t.co/aIKxsPXvnv

Half of the 42 million people who don’t have high-speed internet say it’s because of high monthly costs. Thanks to the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw, over 10 million families are getting help to pay their internet bills.
See if you're eligible for help too: https://t.co/Dh2ftifbk5 https://t.co/OI1K9JxGSj

New Jersey will receive over $800,000 to support seafood processors through funding from @USDA. 

New Jersey’s fishing industry was hard hit by #COVID19 & this funding will help ensure that our seafood processors have support to maintain their operations. https://t.co/P8gInKmiYq

China has a history of violating trade agreements, so we should use caution before lifting tariffs.
The House passed the America COMPETES Act, because it’s time to bring manufacturing and good-paying jobs back to the U.S. & reduce our reliance on China.
https://t.co/Toepv1kVGm

Families who are eligible but have not received the payment must file their taxes. To see if you qualify go to https://t.co/gkpJ2IzT2Q. 

Free assistance with tax filing is available for eligible families. For more information, visit https://t.co/OXSVtm1wn9

The Child Tax Credit has helped families put food on the table and pay rent during the #COVID19 pandemic. 

Thanks to this credit, we were able to reduce child poverty by 40%. 
https://t.co/3iBz9aw16O

It’s good to see the Biden Administration use declassified intelligence to help outmaneuver Putin’s military strategy. 

It’s past time the U.S. stand up to the Kremlin using Putin’s own medicine. 
https://t.co/t89R2xSjV7
Wishing everyone a happy Valentine’s Day! https://t.co/NTnqqaP13O

It’s good to see @SecBlinken use diplomacy to contain China and defuse its aggression. Encouraging democratic institutions and strengthening strategic partnerships with our allies through the Administration’s Indo-Pacific strategy will help hold China accountable. https://t.co/Z4GScb3peL

Trump is using his time in public office to enrich himself and his family. It’s disgusting that he is taking money from people under the guise of charitable donations to fill his own pockets and fund his future political ambitions. 
https://t.co/l8EtBH1rKk

It’s unfortunate that as Democrats work with the Biden Admin to improve our supply chain, Rand Paul advocates for chaos and potential violence. 

This irresponsible call to disrupt the trucking sector could have disastrous consequences at a critical time in our economic recovery. https://t.co/eIO1fqZzr0

While Kroger workers struggle to afford basic living expenses like food and housing, their CEO earns over $22 million per year - 909x more than the median employee. 

Corporate greed should not prevent Americans from reaping the benefits of our growing economy. https://t.co/WIrCjHjVu6

Putin continues to threaten an invasion of Ukraine, which would amount to the largest attack in Europe since World War II. This is exactly why we need to strengthen our alliances with other democratic nations to counteract authoritarian regimes like Russia and China.

Election officials in Texas are rejecting thousands of ballots ahead of the upcoming primary - exactly what Republican legislators intended when they passed one of the nation’s most restrictive voting laws last year. Texans shouldn’t have to jump through these hoops just to vote. https://t.co/dBqlqW5B7b

Thank you @NJPrideChamber for inviting me today to the First Annual Brunch & Brand Launch Party at @10prl in Long Branch. It’s always great to hear about the important work you and your members do for the LGBTQ community in New Jersey.
Proud to join Red Bank Mayor Menna and other Councilmembers as I swore in Angela Mirandi, Red Bank’s newest Councilwoman. https://t.co/4H99K4m29M

Join me now for my weekly update! #FridayswithFrank
https://t.co/wafjnQmp3j

Communities across the country still need funding to replace lead pipes, which is why the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw includes $15 billion for states to do just that. I’ll continue to fight for funding for our state so that everyone can trust the water coming out of the tap.

I joined @VP and @EPAMichaelRegan today in Newark to highlight the successful replacement of the city’s lead pipes. Today is a reminder of what’s possible when we recognize that everyone deserves access to safe drinking water. https://t.co/lRCqhM4VtQ

New Jersey will receive nearly $4 million to restore sport fish populations and $4.4 million to conserve wildlife populations. This funding will help support our state’s thriving fishing industry and outdoor recreation for residents and tourists.
https://t.co/hBek1vJcuN

Safe drinking water is a human right. That's why I’m live in Newark with @VP and @EPAMichaelRegan to highlight our work to replace New Jersey’s dangerous lead service lines.

➡️https://t.co/bsXohX5Yr1 https://t.co/IBy5nvaixu

It is a crime for a President to mishandle or destroy government documents, especially classified information. If there is evidence that Trump intentionally did so, then he should be held accountable.
https://t.co/w5BUku2sk5

We must meet the mental health care and treatment needs of all Americans. I’m holding a #SubOversight hearing next week to explore the breadth of the mental health challenges Americans face, so we can tackle this crisis together. https://t.co/pFykd2tt2O

Thanks to the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw's sweeping broadband investments, @NTIAgov has a unique opportunity to spearhead significant progress in bridging the #DigitalDivide, so next week I'm holding a #SubCommTech hearing to oversee that historic effort.https://t.co/lrQ7iBgy1C

New Jersey will receive over $15 million from the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw for our electric vehicle charging infrastructure. This is a major step forward in our transition to a clean economy that will create jobs while combating the climate crisis.
https://t.co/0LMNQgDW0f
Nothing beats New Jersey Pizza🍕 #NationalPizzaDay https://t.co/sSgym4Mec4

Throughout the pandemic, @NJLaborDept worked to get unemployment benefits out quickly to those that needed it, but some received benefits that they were ineligible for through no fault of their own. I’m glad that @USDOL is expanding the situations when NJDOL can waive repayment. https://t.co/RfCeTHFJFK

#ElectricVehicles are popular for a reason. They help us fight climate change, and they help Americans save tremendous money at the pump. 

That's why our #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw included $7.5 billion to build a nationwide charging network. https://t.co/6tTszXfCWH

Today, the House passed the Global Respect Act, which will help protect LGBTQ people around the world & require the President to prevent human rights abusers from entering the United States.

I'm proud to support this legislation because hate should have no place here in the U.S. https://t.co/9hkcuveqWi

Aliyev continues his efforts to erase Armenian history, despite a @CIJ_ICJ ruling that Azerbaijan must not desecrate or destroy Armenian cultural sites. The international community must halt his actions & hold him accountable for these blatant violations.
https://t.co/0eQRoyvzIm

New Jersey has over 500 brownfield sites. That's why next week I'm holding a hearing on the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw's historic investment to restore these contaminated sites back to economic engines for our community.
https://t.co/9ZkydKZgP6

New Jersey will receive an additional $6 million from @FCC’s Emergency Connectivity Fund Program. Our state has now received over $112 million to help ensure every student and teacher can stay connected to their classroom.
https://t.co/z3j5X3VhZK

Glad to hear Azerbaijan released these Armenian POWs, but Aliyev is required by international law to release all of the detainees he currently holds rather than using them as leverage. 
 
World leaders must continue to push for their immediate release.
https://t.co/OBQPC921Ou

The U.S. Postal Service is one of the oldest and most essential American institutions – with about 500,000 employees working across the nation.

Today, during floor debate, I voiced support for bipartisan legislation to address the challenges facing the Postal Service. https://t.co/HT7phER2AL

On this #SaferInternetDay, I stand with @RepSusanWild in calling on companies like @YouTube to ensure their services aren't hurting our children. We must work together to help those in crisis. If you or someone you know needs help, the Suicide Prevention Lifeline is 800-273-8255.

The registration window for @njhousing’s Emergency Rescue Mortgage Assistance Program is now open. Eligible NJ homeowners facing foreclosure or displacement can receive up to $35,000 in funding from the #AmericanRescuePlan.

Learn more:

🌐https://t.co/V1wFCGNoxW 
📞855-647-7700 https://t.co/3Xf0cjbgIy

.@GovMurphy announced yesterday that the statewide mask mandate for schools and childcare settings will be lifted on March 7th and that he will also extend the public-health emergency for New Jersey for at least another 30 days. https://t.co/Wdw65uJOOQ

Today, my Committee examined a Biden Admin proposal that could enhance the landscape of biomedical research. It’s an opportunity to establish an agency that will enhance fundamental research, leading to breakthrough technologies and healthier patient outcomes. https://t.co/MfhsLCSDln

Millions of Americans sign away their rights in forced arbitration clauses at work and many don’t even know it.

Today, the House passed legislation to #EndForcedArbitration so that survivors of sexual assault and harassment aren’t blocked from seeking justice. https://t.co/E7aEWOMyuy

Today, the @WhiteHouse released a report with recommendations to expand the right to organize for federal employees & contractors. This is an important step to ensure the millions of Americans that work for the federal government know their workplace rights & how to join a union. https://t.co/h61Mf6KOEg

I’ve been fighting for workers my entire time in Congress, because they deserve a voice in the workplace. Congressional employees are an integral part of the important work the federal government does for our country, and I fully support their right to organize.

86% of people living in urban areas are exposed to air pollution levels 7x greater than @WHO guidelines. 

Fossil fuel emissions are causing health problems for millions of Americans every year. That's why we need to transition to clean energy now.
https://t.co/W3KQfZPuwY

Many of the countries in the Asia-Pacific region fear Chinese dominance and want to work with the U.S. to strengthen their security and economic ties. Glad to see the Biden Administration is engaging with them to build a framework for future cooperation.
https://t.co/wdWi6GKwyP

If Russia invades Ukraine, the magnitude of military and civilian casualties and refugees would be immeasurable.

The U.S. must continue working with our NATO allies to avoid a deadly conflict and make Putin understand the grave consequences of his actions.https://t.co/uICV8hxLx7

The City of Newark should serve as a national model for their work to expand safe drinking water. They've made great progress and will be able to do even more with funding from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law to replace lead service lines.
https://t.co/0FZFfps9R7

Joined Laura Jones on NJ Politics to discuss recent funding for NJ libraries through the Emergency Connectivity Fund, the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, and offshore wind development in New Jersey.
https://t.co/foySMQCq7c

The Long Branch arts scene includes two can’t miss shows in February that I saw this weekend, including a new exhibit at the city’s Arts and Cultural Center celebrating #BlackHistoryMonth and a play, “The Promotion”, at the NJ Repertory Theatre on Broadway. https://t.co/5QCkqA6pD5

Putin and Xi are both brutal authoritarians that despise our democratic values. The United States must continue to strengthen our alliances to counteract the spread of their totalitarian ideology. https://t.co/0ymzkDo8px

The events of January 6 were not "legitimate political discourse." It was a violent attack on the Capitol. 
 
The RNC has become so beholden to Donald Trump that Republican Members of Congress cannot even defend the basic tenants of democracy.
https://t.co/1qY3TvxPkw

Glad to see @IRSnews is bringing additional help to prepare for a busy tax season after I joined my colleagues on a letter last month to the IRS Commissioner urging him to help hire new taxpayer advocates to address the tax return backlog.
https://t.co/aiA5WLe535

A new study by @CDCgov shows that wearing any kind of mask indoors provides significant protection from #COVID19 with high-quality N95 and KN95 masks providing the best chance of avoiding infection. https://t.co/hk1hpU5IAO

This is unacceptable. Our servicemen and women who care for our country’s veterans deserve better. There’s simply no reason for them to endure these conditions.
https://t.co/pv17c8YKgH

I met with my 2022 Youth Advisory Council today. I’m grateful for their willingness to share their insight into some of our country’s most pressing challenges. I’m always inspired by the next generation’s dedication to making our country a better place. https://t.co/3OszDQn7VN

This is the second ISIS leader found hiding in areas that Turkish-backed extremists control with at least one Turkish military base nearby. Turkey continues to support violent extremist groups that use terrorists to destabilize the region.

Our special forces, on the order of @POTUS, removed the leader of ISIS as the terrorist group was ramping up deadly actions in the region. I commend the President for taking decisive action to neutralize this growing terrorist threat. https://t.co/DOaiV3emJe

Congratulations to @mattplatkin, who was nominated by @GovMurphy to serve as the Attorney General of New Jersey. I am confident that he will bring strong leadership to @NewJerseyOAG and enforce the law equitably and fairly. https://t.co/1zBmbxIMaX

Today, I led a bipartisan letter with @RepGusBilirakis & over 50 leaders from the Armenian & Hellenic Caucuses to @StateDept & @DeptofDefense that urges them to reject Turkey's dangerous proposal to purchase next-generation F-16 fighter jets & modernization kits from the U.S. https://t.co/eXLnbZnqur

The bill also includes my legislation to develop advanced and continuous manufacturing technology to increase our ability to quickly produce prescription drugs. @RutgersU is already playing a key role in this emerging technology.
https://t.co/ZA6g433bmb

The House just passed the #AmericaCOMPETES Act that will help fix our supply chains and ensure critical products are manufactured right here in America. Provisions from my @EnergyCommerce will prevent shortages of critical goods and invest in our nation’s solar supply chain. https://t.co/LJLkSd5q91

Join me now for my weekly update! #FridayswithFrank
https://t.co/Dt69zGpAyu

LIVE NOW: I join other House leaders to discuss the America COMPETES Act, which ensures that critical goods essential to our economy and national security are made right here in the United States. https://t.co/RhtGGJvBsm

Putin continues to escalate the situation in Ukraine with destabilizing actions throughout the region. The U.S. is committed to ending the conflict, but will not hesitate to impose unprecedented sanctions should Putin continue to walk down this dangerous path.

China continues to violate international law and commit gross human rights abuses, including the genocide of the Uyghur people.
 
The Olympics are a time for us to celebrate the world's best athletes, but we cannot turn a blind eye to the atrocities committed by the host nation.

On this day in 1870, the 15th Amendment of the Constitution was ratified, prohibiting the government from denying a U.S. citizen the right to vote based on their race. Shortly after, Thomas Mundy Peterson of Perth Amboy became the first African-American to vote in an election. https://t.co/6v9EwHFddo

Today I held a hearing on user fee programs that ensure @US_FDA has the resources and personnel it needs to review and approve safe medical treatments, effective drugs, and life-saving vaccines in a timely fashion — a critical program for the health of the American people. https://t.co/tjgB4uNlh7

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act is headed to the House floor today. This bill will restore a strong and robust American manufacturing base that can outcompete China and any other nation. 

I highlighted key provisions out of my Committee. A final vote is expected on Friday. https://t.co/qIjP0E6YBh

Even though their profit margins reached a 70-year high last year, corporate greed is motivating some companies to use the pandemic & supply chain issues as an excuse to raise prices.

Today I held a #SubConsumer hearing on legislation to bring outrageous price gouging to an end. https://t.co/f2AiMy2nhA

Gun violence leaves a mark on each individual and community it impacts.

This Gun Violence Survivors Week, we must all recommit to supporting survivors and taking action to help end gun violence. #GVSurvivorsWeek https://t.co/eab82NmXEd

As Chairman of @EnergyCommerce, I’m working with @POTUS to establish the Advanced Research Projects Agency for Health to drive biomedical innovation and explore the next frontier of medicine.

More details on our #ARPAH hearing here ⬇  
https://t.co/UWUJxNnblv

Athletes and visitors attending the Beijing Olympics should have the right to speak freely, including against China's human rights abuses. 

These actions go against the purported values of the Olympics and it's troubling the IOC and others remain silent.
https://t.co/3qHXaZuWj3

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act ensures that America can outcompete China or any other nation in the world.

Today, I testified before @RulesDemocrats in support of this legislation and highlighted some of the key provisions from my Committee. https://t.co/eGySHHAz4N
Wishing a happy #LunarNewYear to all those who are celebrating! May the Year of the Tiger bring us all peace and happiness.

In a desperate attempt to stay in power, Trump proposed seizing control of the voting machines to discredit the results of the election. 
 
This is the behavior of a lawless authoritarian – not a U.S. President.
https://t.co/4Z3lyhopap

The Trump Admin’s rollback of the hugely successful Mercury & Air Toxics Standards was a reprehensible dismantling of critical human health protections.

I commend the Biden @EPA for taking this step to reverse it and protecting Americans from dangerous, hazardous pollutants. https://t.co/tpnksgijj8

Today marks the start of #BlackHistoryMonth – a time for us to highlight the achievements of Black Americans & recognize their contributions to our nation. This month, we also honor the memory of those that have fought for equality & recommit ourselves to advancing their mission.

Banning books is a dangerous practice that will only hurt our children in the long run. Students need to be exposed to a variety of ideas, history, and literature to develop as well-rounded individuals.
https://t.co/pYcwReZY1Q

A Supreme Court confirmation has traditionally been a bipartisan process. Hopefully, Senate Republicans work with Democrats to approve President Biden's historic nominee on a bipartisan basis and without delay.

Many US metropolitan areas, including New Brunswick, NJ, have seen significant rent increases over the past year. 

The federal government needs to make serious investments in affordable housing and provide rental assistance to those who need it.
https://t.co/mxXZgSqjki

When he lost the election, Trump pressured Vice President Pence to overturn the results.

When Pence did the right thing and certified the results, Trump incited a mob to attack the Capitol.

He continues to show disdain for our democracy to this day. https://t.co/RM3tQJkqkW

The Rutgers exhibition on Kyiv’s Art Revival (1985-1993) at the @zimmerlimuseum is particularly relevant with Putin’s threat to Ukraine. The show highlights artistic movements that showcase the nation’s unique identity. https://t.co/eZjmpHcFfH

Outrageously high prescription drug prices are now even higher as Big Pharma continues its practice of raising prices in January. 
 
It’s time for the Senate to pass my legislation that enables the federal government to negotiate lower prices.
https://t.co/pMc82dcZRm

Proud to cosponsor this resolution that recognizes the ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment and will finally guarantee protections against sex discrimination. 
 
It's past time we enshrine the principle of gender equality in our Constitution. https://t.co/raYDi28Bix

Trump has shown that he won't hesitate to abuse his pardon powers to reward his political supporters. Now, he's promising to pardon the violent criminals that stormed the Capitol on January 6 – the same people that attacked police officers and threatened to destroy our democracy. https://t.co/8Yq98zs2C4
There’s a new member of the First Family! https://t.co/NnDNnVSqNo

It's extremely disappointing to see the court declare Pennsylvania's mail-in voting law unconstitutional. These laws allowed thousands of people to safely cast their ballot in the midst of a pandemic. Voters should not need an excuse to vote by mail.
https://t.co/lXa98uVMo5

Yesterday’s tragic bridge collapse in Pittsburgh should remind us of the urgent need to upgrade our crumbling infrastructure. That's why the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law provides $1.1 billion to modernize the deteriorating bridges in New Jersey.
https://t.co/t2RplLptu9
Due to the weather, @NJTRANSIT has temporarily suspended all bus, River LINE and Access Link services. Service may resume later today, but try to avoid travel if you can. https://t.co/Z74YumWblG

If your power goes out, report it immediately:
 
📞@JCP_L: 1-888-LIGHTSS (1-888-544-4877) or text “OUT” to 544487

🚫Never use a generator indoors. Keep it outdoors at a safe distance from your home. https://t.co/ESIprHKpHS

Today is a big victory for consumers and all those who rely on the internet each day. We must continue our fight to reinstate #NetNeutrality and ensure a free and open internet for all Americans. #SaveTheInternet
